gravity_system: Concrete Slab, ICF Foundation Walls, Piers
other_materials: Extruded Polystyrene, Granular Fill, Vapor Barrier
key_elements: Anchor Bolts, Thickened Slab, Control Joints, Piers
overall_building_description: The structural specifications for the KEL-GOR LTD. New Shop emphasize rigorous compliance with the 2012 Ontario Building Code and local municipal bylaws, ensuring that all construction adheres to the highest standards of safety and performance. The foundation system is meticulously detailed, with the use of Insulated Concrete Form (ICF) walls reinforced with 15M bars, providing robust lateral stability and thermal efficiency. The foundation plan specifies the use of F1554 Grade 36 anchor bolts with heavy hex heads, crucial for securing structural elements and ensuring effective load transfer. Contractors are instructed to utilize pre-engineered building manufacturer drawings for precise anchor bolt layout, underscoring the importance of coordination between design and construction phases. The foundation wall sections incorporate a comprehensive reinforcement strategy, with continuous 15M bars and 15M dowels at 48 inches on center, ensuring structural integrity and load distribution. The typical foundation wall section includes an 8-inch concrete slab reinforced with two layers of 10 bars at 12 inches on center, placed on a 6 mil vapor barrier and 2-inch rigid insulation, optimizing thermal performance and moisture control. The pier details for types B and C are critical for supporting vertical loads, with 25M vertical rebar and 15M ties at 12 inches on center, and a triple tie at the top for enhanced stability. The thickened slab detail at the breezeway incorporates a 6x6x6/6 welded wire mesh or a 16-inch by 16-inch 10M grid, providing additional reinforcement and crack control. The slab is insulated with extruded polystyrene, offering a minimum compressive strength of 30 psi, and is supported by compacted granular 'A' for optimal load-bearing capacity. The floor slab control joint detail specifies a sawcut depth of 'T'/5, with continuous reinforcement through the joint, ensuring effective crack control and load transfer. The joint is filled with sealant, and the face is painted with oil prior to the second pour, preventing moisture ingress and ensuring long-term durability. The general notes emphasize the importance of not scaling drawings and the contractor's responsibility to verify all dimensions and report discrepancies, highlighting the critical role of accuracy and precision in construction. The use of 15M bent dowels at overhead door locations, spaced at 12 inches on center, ensures effective load transfer and structural continuity. The detailed specifications and construction details provided in the drawings are essential for ensuring the structural integrity and performance of the building, with a focus on load path analysis, connection details, and compliance with relevant codes and standards. The integration of advanced materials and construction techniques, such as ICF walls and extruded polystyrene insulation, demonstrates a commitment to sustainability and energy efficiency, while the detailed reinforcement layouts and anchor bolt specifications ensure robust structural performance and safety. The project exemplifies a comprehensive approach to industrial building design, with a focus on precision, coordination, and compliance with industry standards.
